issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
Fullscreen window redraws itself after device rotation from landscape to portrait mode, and pressing "Close" button.

Not a regression, occurs in 2.0.2 as well.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run KitchenSink-Nook in landscape
2. Go to Base UI - Window (Standalone)
3. Press "Open (Fullscreen)" button
4. Rotate device to portrait mode

Actual result:
Fullscreen window redraws itself

Expected result:
Fullscreen window shouldn't redraw itself
fields.summary: Android: Fullscreen window redraws itself after device rotation
fields.environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.0.201206200844
Titanium SDK: 2.1.0.v20120619172256
Device: Kindle Fire

comments.body: Issue cannot be reproduced with sdk versions 3.0.2, 3.1.0. Tested on android 4.0.4 .
Closing ticket as the issue cannot be reproduced.
